intro: Hieracium seniliforme, commonly known as the old man's beard, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant has a sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its common name refers to the long, silky hairs that cover the flower heads, resembling an old man's beard.
